ygData.subject: RE: dual weild

ygData.messageBody:
There is a base skill number for each level. When you get Dual Wield at
17th, your skill is already (level * 2). I know this only because when I
became a Guide (a Bard, BTW) I was buffed to Apprentice Guide status (level
20) by the server's GM. So off I went at level 20 without having trained
any skills. Guides and GMs are just player characters, so I had to start
pounding my Sense Heading button to train the skill up. Much to my surpise
my first increase was "You have become better at Sense Heading(41)."

Crier Sharpsong


> From: scott@... (scott brisko)
>
> I had an odd experience with training or not training duel wield.
>
> I hit level 17 and decided to head back to Kelethin to pick my new song. I
> knew that I could now use duel wield and that I probably need to
> point into
> it for it to work, but I forgot to train in Freeport before I
> left, and then
> when I arrived at Kelethin I forgot to train there as well.
>
> Now back in Freeport I went to the guild intent on putting some
> points into
> duel wield before I returned to hunting in Oasis. But to my
> surprise when I
> scrolled down to duel wield in the skills window I did not see
> the friendly
> "no charge" text, but a charge of 1 plat 3 gold. Hmmm.
>
> So off I went to oasis, equipped my dwarven axe and combine longsword and
> proceeded to pound crocs..
>
> You have become better at duel wield (35)
>
> So I am stumped. I never tried to use two weapons before, didn't train it,
> and all of a sudden I am starting out with a skill of 34.
>
> Any ideas?
>
> Bernwyn
